Privacy Policy

Kana Challenges iOS App

Effective Date: March 15, 2025

Kana Challenges ("we," "our," or "us") values your privacy. This Privacy Policy explains how we handle your information when you use our mobile application ("the App").

1. Information We Collect

We collect certain types of data to improve app functionality and user experience. The information collected falls into the following categories:

a. Analytics and Usage Data

We use Mixpanel to collect non-personal usage data, including:

  • App interactions (e.g., screens viewed, features used)
  • Session duration and engagement time
  • Game results, challenge completions, and achievements
  • Device information (e.g., operating system, app version)

b. Identifiers

A randomly generated installation ID is stored on your device to recognize returning users without linking to personally identifiable information.

No user accounts or personally identifiable information (such as email addresses) are collected.

2. How We Use Your Information

We use the collected data solely for the following purposes:

  • Improving app performance and user experience
  • Analyzing feature usage and engagement trends
  • Identifying and fixing technical issues
  • Ensuring the stability and security of the App

We do not use collected data for personalized advertising or user tracking across third-party apps and websites.

3. Third-Party Services

We use the following third-party services for analytics:

  • Mixpanel – Tracks app events and usage patterns.

This service may process data in accordance with its respective privacy policy.

4. Device Permissions

The App may request access to the following device features:

  • Wi-Fi – To enable in-app purchases through Apple's App Store.
  • Storage – To save and manage game progress and settings locally on your device.

All accessed data remains on your device and is not transmitted to external servers, except for anonymous analytics data as described above.

5. Children's Privacy

The App is not intended for children under the age of 13. We do not knowingly collect or store any personal information from children, and we comply with the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act (COPPA) by design.

6. Managing Your Data

You can delete the app to remove all stored data, including installation ID and locally saved files.

7. Changes to This Privacy Policy

We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time. Any changes will be reflected in the "Effective Date" above. Continued use of the App after an update constitutes your acceptance of the revised Privacy Policy.

8. Contact Us

If you have any questions or concerns about this Privacy Policy, please contact us at: twosixmitch@gmail.com
